Write program to display the message as 
"object oriented programming" if input is java
"procedural and object oriented programming" if input is c++
"structural programming language" if input is c 

Using Polymorphism

To implement this create a base class ProgrammingLanguage
and child classes CLanguage and C++Language
write display method in all the three classes.

at last create a test class write the do-while with switch case
[refer my last program on polymorphism]


 abstract public class ProgrammingLanguage {

	public ProgrammingLanguage() {
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}
	
	abstract public void displayMessage();
}

public class JavaLanguage extends ProgrammingLanguage{

	
	public JavaLanguage() {
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}
	
	
	public void displayMessage() {
		 System.out.println("object oriented programming");
	}
}


public class CLanguage extends ProgrammingLanguage {
	
	public CLanguage() {
		// TODO Auto-generated constructor stub
	}
	
	@Override
	public void displayMessage() {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		System.out.println("structural programming language");
		
	}
	

}

public class CPlusLanguage extends ProgrammingLanguage {
	
	CPlusLanguage(){
		
	}
	
	@Override
	public void displayMessage() {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		
		System.out.println("procedural and object oriented programming");
		
	}

}


public class TestProgrammingLanguage {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
		String ch ;
	
		
				
do {
	System.out.println("Enter Java,C or C++");
	ch = sc.next();
	switch(ch) {
	
	case "Java":
	
		ProgrammingLanguage pr = new JavaLanguage();
		pr.displayMessage();
		System.out.println();
		break;
		
	case "C" :
		pr = new CLanguage();
		pr.displayMessage();
		System.out.println();
		break;
		
	case "C++":
		pr = new CPlusLanguage();
	    pr.displayMessage();
	    
	}
	    
}  while(ch.equals("Java" ) || ch.equals("C") || ch.equals("C++"));
	
	}

}
